channel.title: Comments on: The Regulative Principle of the Church 7: Its Biblical Support—First Argument

item.title: By: Robert Gonzales Jr
item.dc:creator: Robert Gonzales Jr
item.description:
Oops. I made a few typos above ...
In the first comment, I should have said, "those commentators are wrong who ARGUE that Cain’s offering was rejected because it wasn’t a blood sacrifice."
In the second comment, I inadvertently omitted "we" between "which" and "worship" at the end of the first sentence.
Also, I should have capitalized "God" in the last sentence.
item.content:encoded:
Oops. I made a few typos above …

In the first comment, I should have said, “those commentators are wrong who ARGUE that Cain’s offering was rejected because it wasn’t a blood sacrifice.”

In the second comment, I inadvertently omitted “we” between “which” and “worship” at the end of the first sentence.

Also, I should have capitalized “God” in the last sentence.
